utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We’re pinned down.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We can’t get through.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sheldon, get over here and help.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, one second.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, why are you jumping up and down?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m trying to shoot.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Then use the shoot button, not the wonderful thing about Tiggers button.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Aw.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’s it, we’re dead.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, challenge them again.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Doing it right now. Oh, they can’t. There’s an important Little League game tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No wonder they beat us, they’re jocks.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What happened to me? I used to excel at these things.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Kids are always better at video games.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I don’t like it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mm, if it makes you feel better, you still dress like a child.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, but it’s not just video games. I downloaded the new O.S. for my phone, took me a week to stop accidentally texting kissy faces to everyone.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, so our love is not real?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, I know how you feel. I tried one of those electronic Japanese toilets, practically shot myself across the room.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I guess I just need to face it, I’m no longer a wunderkind. Now I just wonder what’s for lunch.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hot dogs.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yay.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I didn’t know you could drink while you’re breastfeeding.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, they say the yeast in beer helps with milk production.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m pretty sure that’s a myth, let me check.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Ruin it for me and I’ll break this glass over your head.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: To denial.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ooh. I’m gonna get another. You want food?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, breastfeeding burns, like, 5,000 calories a day. Do not touch that phone.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Penny?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, Zack. Hey.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: What are the odds of running into you here?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, it’s a bar, so pretty good. Uh, what’s new?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Oh, tons of stuff. Put artificial grass in my backyard, got engaged, had a scary mole that turned out to be Sharpie.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, congratulations.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: That’s what my dermatologist said.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, on, on getting engaged, good for you.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Oh, thanks. How about you? Hey, how’s Leonard? Is he still smart?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes, yes, he’s working for the government on an infinite persistence gyroscope. Of course, the first time I say it right, he’s not even here.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: I love that little guy. Hey, we should all have dinner sometime.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, yeah, sure, I’ll check with Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Cool, I’ll check with Sara. Sara, pull up my calendar. It never works for me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ve been thinking about our recent humiliation.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re gonna have to be more specific.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: At the hands of those teenagers.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: More.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Boy teenagers.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, the video game. Yeah, that was bad.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I started doing some reading on cognitive vitality, and I came across an area of research called super-aging.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know who’s a super-ager? Jennifer Lopez. Like, what is her secret?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Now, this is rare. I don’t know which one of you I want to stop talking first.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The theory is that if you really tax your brain, the neurofibers will become thicker and the glial cells more lustrous.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Like J-Lo’s hair.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Boy, it is neck and neck right now.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How is super-aging any different than, like, doing crossword puzzles?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, it’s not just doing simple cognitive tasks. You need to push your brain out of its comfort zone and reach mental exhaustion.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I drive you to work every day, my brain must look like the Hulk.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: If you really want to challenge yourself, you could learn to speak Hindi.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Jab mein aat saal ka tha maine seekha tha.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Could you say that in English? I actually, I never learned Hindi.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, you ready to go?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, I guess.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s the matter?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Honestly? It’s a little strange having dinner with your ex-boyfriend, and it’s not like we have a lot to talk about.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What? He loves you, okay? And he’s interested in your work. You could talk about the infinite perspective… I swear I know it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’ll be fine, let’s just go.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, and his fiancée will be there, so you know, if the conversation lags, we can talk about their wedding.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Aaargh.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Come on, I spent an entire plane ride with you talking about the trailer for Deadpool 2.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ha, I knew you weren’t asleep.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Hey, guys.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi. Hey, where’s your fiancée?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Oh, she couldn’t make it. She had an emergency.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, no, what happened?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: I didn’t ask.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What smells so good?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Raj is teaching me to make croissants.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Is this part of your super-aging?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. Yeah, it seemed daunting at first, but then I realized, it’s like the chemistry set I had as a kid. Only, when your brother eats this, no one has to call Poison Control.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay. Shall we? Oh, my God. It’s light, it’s flaky, it’s buttery. You don’t need to have sex with him, just eat one of these.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, it is delicious. Physicist, baker, lover, what can’t I do?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, clearly mental tasks are not enough. Maybe you need to challenge your motor skills.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: For the last time, I am not having a tickle fight with you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You want a real challenge, try keeping me from eating more of these.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re just using food to mask the fear that you’re fundamentally unlovable and therefore going to be alone forever.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Damn it, he’s good at that, too.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Thanks. Wow, working on a top secret government project, that is so cool. Do you have a bodyguard to keep spies away?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I have Sheldon, that keeps most people away.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: I miss that guy. He’s like the Swedish Chef Muppet. I don’t know what he’s saying, but he’s funny.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, I know what he’s saying, and he’s not, he’s not funny.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: So, Penny, what’s going on with you? How’s the job?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, it’s okay, I’m still in pharmaceutical sales.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: She’s doing amazing. She can actually make a side effect, like 10% chance of liver failure, sound like a 90% chance of liver success.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, lying isn’t my favourite part of the job. Actually, I’m not crazy about a lot of it.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Hey, if you’re not happy there, I’ve been looking for a new head of sales at my company. And we don’t sell drugs, just menus, so the only lie you’ll be telling is we print on recycled paper. We don’t.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, that’s a nice offer.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: You know, we’d make a great team. Or as we say in the menu business, I can’t do this without Me N U.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Right, ’cause it spells menu.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Yeah, right? It’s funny. I got a lot of menu jokes, but that’s my favourite.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right, this is everything. What do you want to learn?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It really doesn’t matter, as long as it’s challenging.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, well, how about, oh, I teach you some close-up magic.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Howard, I’m trying to make myself uncomfortable, not everyone else.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So you wanted to learn something physical and you came to Howard Wolowitz?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, the circus arts are very physically and mentally demanding. Have you ever tried to juggle?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yes, I’m juggling my love for you and my embarrassment of you right now.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And it’s hard, isn’t it? So the key is, the moment one ball is at the top of its arc, you toss the next one. Hmm?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, I think I got that.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Uh, hold on. There’s an old saying in juggling.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Is it I’m going to die alone?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, it’s if you want to have fun, start with one. Yours we think, but we do not say. All right, just toss it up and catch it a few times, get comfortable with it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay. Just to be on the safe side, am I in any danger of getting juggler’s elbow?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you sure? ‘Cause I’m feeling a twinge.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: See, that wasn’t so bad. He even picked up the check.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah. Although, when he was trying to figure out the tip, I’m pretty sure I saw smoke coming out of his ears. You’re not really considering working for him, are you?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, maybe, I mean, it seems kind of perfect. I have sales experience, and I’ve been a waitress, so I have restaurant experience, and if he’s figuring out my Christmas bonus, we could buy a boat.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Don’t you think it might be a little weird to work for someone you used to date?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You work with Sheldon, you tell me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s weird.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, are you seriously jealous of me working with Zack?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, no, I’m not jealous, I just think you have got a good thing going where you are right now, and you make great money and you haven’t slept with any of your co-workers.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Great, so you want me to stay at a job I’m not happy at?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You okay? You kind of look like Zack trying to figure out that tip.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Of course I don’t want you to be unhappy, but I also want you to be smart, and working for an ex-boyfriend isn’t very smart. You don’t have to stop, just slow down, I’ll jump out.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy, look, I’m on a unicycle!

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: How did you get from croissants to a unicycle?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I hurt myself juggling.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Where did you get it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Howard said I could borrow it, Bernadette said forever.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Have you tried letting go of the rope?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What, are you crazy? I’m on a unicycle.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: All right, well, have fun.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait, I need help getting down.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, what do you want me to do?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Drag out our mattress and put it over here, then go across the hall, get their mattress and put it over here. But before you do any of that, scratch my nose.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So you told her she was being dumb?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, I told her she was being not smart. Which was dumb.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Why did you even go to dinner with the guy?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We covered this, I’m dumb.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So he’s my ex-boyfriend, who cares? I can’t believe Leonard would be so insecure.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Really? I have no trouble believing that at all.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And Zack’s engaged. Leonard has no reason to feel threatened.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: We’re talking about the same Leonard, right?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So you think it’s fine if she works for Zack?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t know, maybe.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, he is much more attractive than Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes, but that’s gonna be true of a lot of guys she works for.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, but she also used to sleep with Zack.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Again.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I would never let Howard work with an ex.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What, you wouldn’t trust him?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I wouldn’t trust her. He’s thin and sexy like a Jewish greyhound.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, that, that is the sexiest dog.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: And I’d like to think Howie wouldn’t take a job I was uncomfortable with.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: ‘Cause he’s scared of you?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Terrified.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know what? I’m with Leonard, this isn’t cool.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I disagree. Penny is a strong, independent woman. The more you try to control her, the more she’ll push back.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So you think it’s okay?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, no, she’s gonna leave you for someone, might as well get it over with.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m returning this stuff to Howard.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh. Well, Bernadette made me promise if you didn’t want it, we’d give it to a homeless clown. What happened to learning the unicycle?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I stopped that, it was dumb. Uni, bi, tri, menstrual, all cycles are dumb.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You said juggling was dumb, too.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, it is. If I wanted to hold three things at once, I’d wear cargo pants.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, is it possible that when things get really difficult, you just give up?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you calling me a quitter?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, if you honestly…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This conversation is over.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: His mother warned me. Everybody warned me. Actually, he warned me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You want to talk?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That doesn’t seem to be where I shine. How about I just give you one of these?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Look, we can have a reasonable conversation and I won’t get mad. I don’t like it after sex, and I don’t like it now.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, sorry.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. All right, just come here. Look, I get me working with Zack is weird and I don’t want you to be uncomfortable.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, thanks. And I don’t want you to be stuck at a job you don’t like.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Then what do we do?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, I don’t love it, but if you really want to take this job, I’ll find a way to deal with it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, I know you’ll try, but it’ll make you miserable, which will make me miserable, and I’m just gonna stay where I’m at for now.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, you’re, you’re unhappy there and then you’re gonna blame me for making you stay, and it’s fine, I’ll just, I’ll suck it up.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You don’t need to do that, it’s okay.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, see, now I feel terrible, like I’m being selfish and holding you back. What? Say something. Yeah, that is pretty annoying.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I made you tea.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m sorry I called you a quitter.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s okay, I stopped being upset about that. And no, the irony is not lost on me.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What are you reading?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This article says the peak age for making a Nobel Prize-winning discovery is 40.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So I’m running out of time.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That’s ridiculous, you’re a brilliant man. The best years of your life are still ahead of you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, you have to say that, you’re sweet on me.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, if you’re really worried about your career, maybe you should consider spending a little less time with video games and comic books.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hey, I thought you were sweet on me.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay, fine, let’s say you never win a Nobel Prize. Let’s say you spend your life doing solid scientific research surrounded by friends and loved ones who appreciate you, not for what you’ve accomplished but for who you are as a man. Wouldn’t that be a life well-lived?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re so cute. I’m gonna go learn how to walk on stilts.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So many warnings.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, are you sure about this?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Absolutely. I just want you to be happy. And maybe a little turned on about how selfless I’m being.

utterance.speaker: Zack (on phone)
utterance.content: Penny, what’s up?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, uh, so I’ve been thinking about it and I want to take the job.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Oh, bad news. When my fiancée found out that I was offering a job to my ex-girlfriend, she said it was a stupid idea and threw a shoe at me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, so there’s no job?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Nope, just a little bump on my forehead.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, thanks anyway. Bye. Well, his fiancée thought the idea of us working together was stupid. You were right, I was wrong. Aren’t you gonna say anything?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Not if I want to be doing this later.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hey, I didn’t know you were home. Where you been?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I went to see your mom.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Seriously, where were you?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I just told you, your mom’s.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, since you find my magic tricks so embarrassing, I got to wondering what cool hobbies you had as a kid.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh. What’d she say?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: She didn’t say much of anything. But she said a lot. Hi, Bernadette, remember me?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: First of all, that’s not what she sounds like, she’s from South Carolina.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I can’t believe you made fun of me all these years while you were a closeted ventriloquist.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Okay, it’s not like I wanted to be a ventriloquist. I was in beauty pageants and I needed a talent besides spreading rumours that the other contestants were pregnant.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, since you enjoyed getting rid of all my stuff, you know, maybe we should throw this little lady in the wood chipper.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No. And the little lady has a name.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Which is?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Tammy Jo St. Cloud.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Tammy Jo St. Cloud. Oh, and I’m a dork for juggling.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Sorry, you’re not a dork. You’re a clown. Tammy Jo, don’t say that, you’ll make him feel bad. Look at him, what reason he got to feel good?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right, very funny.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Don’t listen to her, she’s been in a box for, like, 25 years. Yeah, back when his haircut was fashionable.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s enough, put her away.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette (as Doll)
utterance.content: Oh, big daddy, I don’t think so. You marry Miss Bernie, you marry me. We all family now.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right, you’re freaking me out.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette (as Doll)
utterance.content: Don’t be that way. If you don’t mind a few splinters, we can have us a ménage à trois. Ooh.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m doing it. I’m doing it. I’m tall and I’m doing it. Ah, man.
